content: why was transmute chosen to do transmutations instead of making something like an unsafe cast? why a function instead of leveraging the existing cast keyword?

as doesn't allow specifying the types, and it's also overloaded to do many different things. People have actually been introducing new APIs to libstd so as can be used less: https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.pointer.html#method.cast
my_i32 as f32 and transmute<i32, f32> are very different things
transmute is basically type punning, not a cast
